reviewText: This is another in the series of operettas that were made into movies by Unitel and released on DVD by DG.  Like the others in the series, the performances are very good with excellent singing, costumes, & sets. A Night in Venice, although the story is rather silly, has many great Strauss tunes. Unfortunately, the director seems to have gotten carried away with using photographic tricks such as distorting images etc.
summary: Excellent performance but tries to be too artsie
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a decent evening's amusement.  It's worth watching once, but it's not something we will watch again and again.  Both the plot and the music are inferior to most of Johann Strauss Jr.'s other work.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The production was very good; the singing was very good; the quality of the disc is very good. It should have deserved a four star rating. My problem is in the operetta itself. I just don’t like the music. It is nothing like the other operetta that I know. It is not tuneful at all. Yet, there are very few tunes that one can remember after watching it. Those two numbers sang by the tenor were OK, but the gondola song only lasted a few bars. If I were introduced to operetta by this one first I don’t think I would have become an operetta enthusiast.
Title: N/A

reviewText: An absolute delight.  Story rewritten for TV but who cares?  The music is still just as beautiful.
Title: N/A

reviewText: You could not ask for a better operetta movie with respect to singing, music, acting, and fabulous sets. But, the story line centers on much infidelity, womanizing, but nevertheless gets resolved at the end.
Title: N/A
